title: [UX] All default values displayed in usage
body:
## Description

Some default values are displayed in usage while some are not, all default value should be displayed, this is confusing and require the user to research some information that could be displayed easily.

## Present Behaviour

```
%> ./beacon_node --help
Lighthouse Lighthouse/v0.1.0-unstable/x86_64-linux
Sigma Prime <contact@sigmaprime.io>
Eth 2.0 Client

USAGE:
    beacon_node [FLAGS] [OPTIONS] [SUBCOMMAND]

FLAGS:
    -h, --help       Prints help information
        --no-api     Disable RESTful HTTP API server.
        --no-grpc    Disable the gRPC server.
        --no-ws      Disable websocket server.
    -V, --version    Prints version information

OPTIONS:
        --api-address <ADDRESS>           Set the listen address for the RESTful HTTP API server.
        --api-port <PORT>                 Set the listen TCP port for the RESTful HTTP API server.
        --boot-nodes <ENR-LIST>           One or more comma-delimited base64-encoded ENR's to bootstrap the p2p network.
        --datadir <DIR>                   Data directory for keys and databases.
        --db <DB>                         Type of database to use. [default: disk]  [possible values: disk, memory]
        --debug-level <LEVEL>             The title of the spec constants for chain config. [default: trace]  [possible
                                          values: info, debug, trace, warn, error, crit]
        --discovery-address <ADDRESS>     The IP address to broadcast to other peers on how to reach this node.
        --disc-port <PORT>                The discovery UDP port.
        --eth1-server <SERVER>            Specifies the server for a web3 connection to the Eth1 chain.
        --libp2p-addresses <MULTIADDR>    One or more comma-delimited multiaddrs to manually connect to a libp2p peer
                                          without an ENR.
        --listen-address <ADDRESS>        The address lighthouse will listen for UDP and TCP connections. (default
                                          127.0.0.1).
        --logfile <FILE>                  File path where output will be written.
        --maxpeers <maxpeers>             The maximum number of peers (default 10).
        --network-dir <DIR>               Data directory for network keys.
        --p2p-priv-key <HEX>              A secp256k1 secret key, represented as ASCII-encoded hex bytes (with or
                                          without 0x prefix).
        --port <PORT>                     The TCP/UDP port to listen on. The UDP port can be modified by the
                                          --discovery-port flag.
    -b, --port-bump <INCREMENT>           Sets all listening TCP/UDP ports to default values, but with each port
                                          increased by INCREMENT. Useful when starting multiple nodes on a single
                                          machine. Using increments in multiples of 10 is recommended.
        --rpc-address <ADDRESS>           Listen address for RPC endpoint.
        --rpc-port <PORT>                 Listen port for RPC endpoint.
        --topics <STRING>                 One or more comma-delimited gossipsub topic strings to subscribe to.
        --ws-address <ADDRESS>            Set the listen address for the websocket server.
        --ws-port <PORT>                  Set the listen TCP port for the websocket server.

SUBCOMMANDS:
    help       Prints this message or the help of the given subcommand(s)
    testnet    Create a new Lighthouse datadir using a testnet strategy.

```

Only `db`, `debug-level`, `listen-address` and `maxpeers` flags display their default values.

## Expected Behaviour

Display default values for all flags that have one.

## Steps to resolve

Unknown
Thanks @Magicking! I've been thinking about this lately, we'll make sure it happens :)
I believe we are conforming to this now, I have certainly been paying attention to it. I'll close this for now :)
